channel.title: Can't install windows back over Ubuntu
channel.description: First of all, I'm trying to flash my BIOS. My AC Adapter for my laptop isn't working. I looked it up on the dell support site and they said my BIOS may be out of date. The file they gave to flash the BIOS is an exe so I tried running it through wine but it won't work. It gives me an error. I decided that I'd just install windows XP real quick just so I could flash my BIOS but when I use the reinstall disk it tells me that there are no valid partitions on my hard drive and the set up can't continue. What should I do? I just want to charge the replacement laptop battery I got for christmas... :(

item.title: Can't install windows back over Ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

shrink your ubuntu install’s partition(s) to free up some space, install xp in the free space, repair grub with the utility provided with ubuntu, all is well.

ps: you’re supposed to burn the executable to a disk/create a bootable flash/floppy to flash your bios.

Read full topic
item.source: Can't install windows back over Ubuntu

item.title: Can't install windows back over Ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @sp11k3t3ht3rd sp11k3t3ht3rd
item.description:
@sp11k3t3ht3rd wrote:

First of all, I’m trying to flash my BIOS. My AC Adapter for my laptop isn’t working. I looked it up on the dell support site and they said my BIOS may be out of date. The file they gave to flash the BIOS is an exe so I tried running it through wine but it won’t work. It gives me an error. I decided that I’d just install windows XP real quick just so I could flash my BIOS but when I use the reinstall disk it tells me that there are no valid partitions on my hard drive and the set up can’t continue. What should I do? I just want to charge the replacement laptop battery I got for christmas…
